prompt: What is the Constructive Dilemma rule?
options: From (P → Q) and (R → S) and (P ∨ R), derive (Q ∨ S)
From (P → Q) and (Q → R), derive (P → R)
From P and Q, derive (P ∧ Q)
hint: This rule combines two conditionals with a disjunction.
explanation: Constructive Dilemma (CD): From (P → Q), (R → S), and (P ∨ R), derive (Q ∨ S). If either P or R is true, and P leads to Q while R leads to S, then either Q or S must be true.
visual_concept: Two roads diverge: Left path (P) leads to Q, right path (R) leads to S. If you must take one path (P ∨ R), you'll reach Q or S.
